channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Financial firms from Stripe to Circle are building their own blockchains—here’s why
item.description: Stripe is developing what it calls Tempo, and Circle announced Tuesday that it’s building a protocol called Arc.

item.title: Gen Z and young millennials are driving a great American drinking decline, Gallup poll shows
item.description: About two-thirds of 18- to 34-year-olds believe moderate drinking is unhealthy, according to the poll, up from about four in 10 in 2015.

item.title: Match Group agrees to pay $14 million to the FTC for misleading ads
item.description: Company faced deceptive business charges from 2019.

item.title: Kodak’s corporate doom: 133-year-old photo icon warns investors it may cease operations with $500 million debt problem
item.description: "They blew their future," one expert said.

item.title: AI is already creating a billionaire boom: There are now 498 AI unicorns—and they’re worth $2.7 trillion
item.description: AI is attracting wealth faster than a ChatGPT search, bringing in more billion-dollar valuations than the dot-com boom has ever seen.

item.title: Monthly release of U.S. jobs data will continue, insists Treasury chief Bessent
Perplexity says it wants to buy Google’s Chrome. Wall Street says it’s a stunt.
Economic calendar: Three Fed speakers on agenda, then another inflation update
Has the time-honored 15% tip for restaurant service become the norm again?
Homeowners jump at the chance to refi as mortgage rates plunge
